bioconda.name: bioconductor-globalancova
bioconda.summary: Global test for groups of variables via model comparisons

biotools.summary: We give the following arguments in support this approach: After normalization, gene-expression-data appears symmetrical and outliers are no problem, least squares should be robust. ANCOVA with interaction yields saturated data modelling e.g. different means per group and gene. Covariate adjustment can help to correct for possible selection bias. Variance homogeneity and uncorrelated residuals can’t be expected. Application of ordinary least squares gives unbiased, no longer optimal estimates.
